title: How to Become an Ultimate Anime Fan

steps.title: Decide which anime you want to watch based on general type, demographic, or themes.
steps.content: Decide which anime you want to watch based on general type, demographic, or themes. You can try lots of different series and even movies.

steps.title: Start by researching.
steps.content: Start by researching. If you don't have a favorite anime series or movie, find out what that is first and then surf the web for fan sites so you can learn more about it and find out about similar anime. Go a little further in your research than just the plot or characters. If it's a historical anime, research the period in history. Find out what genre it is too. Wikipedia has a good article that breaks down the different anime genres.

steps.title: Consider buying some.
steps.content: Consider buying some. After you have an idea of the anime you like, start investing some serious time into it...and cash. Most rental stores have an okay selection of anime now, and often Adult Swim has a decent anime lineup, but you'll probably have to buy most of what you watch (or, if you're lucky, you can borrow from or trade with friends). Price shop as much as possible, and go for box sets whenever you can. Don't forget about graphic novels!

steps.title: Cover your room with anime posters and toys.
steps.content: Cover your room with anime posters and toys. Get posters from a local comic shop or online.

steps.title: Subscribe to or buy magazines like Anime Insider and Newtype.
steps.content: Subscribe to or buy magazines like Anime Insider and Newtype. They show Anime in Japan and what will be hot in the U.S. Knowing more about upcoming anime makes you a more well-informed fan.

steps.title: Watch with subtitles.
steps.content: Watch with subtitles. Learning to watch anime in Japanese with subtitles is essential.

steps.title: Stop downloading once licensed.
steps.content: Stop downloading once licensed. There are many great scanlation sites out there to get anime and manga that are only available in Japan in English! It is important to support your favorite mangaka (Manga artist) and type of fandom. Be sure to stop downloading from these sites once the anime is licensed. See tips below.

steps.title: Buy accessories including t-shirts, plushes, keychains, stickers, model kits, soundtracks, and even weapons (such as Kenshin's reverse-blade sword).
steps.content: Buy accessories including t-shirts, plushes, keychains, stickers, model kits, soundtracks, and even weapons (such as Kenshin's reverse-blade sword). Even more time and money go into this stage. Don't forget the music and graphics for your computer.

steps.title: Develop your anime persona.
steps.content: Develop your anime persona. Plenty of online quizzes can let you know which anime character you are - so find out! You may even find an RPG to help you live your fantasy out with. Most characters have a signature technique or phrase, so try thinking up one of your own and sprinkle it into conversations or battles.

steps.title: Start a fan site.
steps.content: Start a fan site. This is where you can write plot summaries, put up pictures of your collectibles (and yourself in costume if you wish), and start message boards. Choose your clever domain name before it's gone!

steps.title: Start drawing Anime!
steps.content: Start drawing Anime! It's always good to know how to draw it too!
